TopicTitle: I would like a nice "more plannet & moons" mod... Any suggestion please?

Articles.Content:
Hello... I'm new here I've been recently exploring most of the planets I could... But before I land in all of them, I would like to ask if you guys could suggest me a nice mod for more bodies :)

The only problem... Is that some of them are not working, like New Horizons and Planet Factory, and yes, I have bought my KSP on steam... But even if I get a new mod, well, I'm kinda a little scared of losing all the things I did in Science mode, and have to start all from scratch again, teehee...

So if someone knows a cool mod for more planets, please tell me. <3

New Horizons isn't working? Seems to be working mostly fine for me.

Prior to NH my first extra planet romp was with Outer Planets. I'd heartily recommend either (or both!)

If you're not afraid of challenges, I'd suggest Real Solar System and RSS Planets and Moons Expanded. But, seeing you're new to the game, that might not be the most appropriate for you

Anyway, take a look here, in the "Universe/Planet Alterations" section. It gives you a few mods which change the Kerbin system.

If your current mods are not working, make sure you have installed the Kopernicus mod, most of solar system modifying mods (if not all) require it, and some do not have it included, so you have to download it by yourself.

EDIT: after a quick check, NH requires Kopernicus and it is not included in the mod files, so you do have to download it yourself. Also, I couldn't find anything related to Planet Factory less than 2 years old, so the mod is most likely outdated and dead; please put the link from where you found this mod.

Edited August 25, 2015 by Gaarst

Virtually all planet mods nowadays use Kopernicus, which you may need to download and install separately.

Adding planets can mess up the positions of existing craft. The Outer Planets Mod doesn't suffer that issue so it's a good pick to add on an existing save.

New Horizons isn't working? Seems to be working mostly fine for me.

Prior to NH my first extra planet romp was with Outer Planets. I'd heartily recommend either (or both!)

No offense... But I quite didn't like NH bc it makes Kerbin a moon instead of a planet, and that hurts my feelings.. But maybe it didnt work bc I didnt have Kopernicus at the time... But is it possible to install 2 mods of planets??? O_O

If you're not afraid of challenges, I'd suggest Real Solar System and RSS Planets and Moons Expanded. But, seeing you're new to the game, that might not be the most appropriate for you

Anyway, take a look here, in the "Universe/Planet Alterations" section. It gives you a few mods which change the Kerbin system.

If your current mods are not working, make sure you have installed the Kopernicus mod, most of solar system modifying mods (if not all) require it, and some do not have it included, so you have to download it by yourself.

EDIT: after a quick check, NH requires Kopernicus and it is not included in the mod files, so you do have to download it yourself. Also, I couldn't find anything related to Planet Factory less than 2 years old, so the mod is most likely outdated and dead; please put the link from where you found this mod.

Thank you!! I will for now try the Outer Planets... When I get used to it, I'll get to RSS

No offense... But I quite didn't like NH bc it makes Kerbin a moon instead of a planet, and that hurts my feelings..

Haha yeah it's not for everyone
